title: Drawing, "Design for Printed Textile-Pebbles, Series 1980-85", 1960
medium: Brush and black ink, graphite and red colored pencil on three pieces of white tracing paper, fastened together with tape
inscribed:
Main sheet [A]: in red pencil, center below image "24"; in red pencil lower right corner: "Center"; in graphite lower center: "original drawing"
Second sheet [B]: in graphite upper left corner: "match with / original / drawing [ letter c inscribed in a circle] / "repeat / vertical revision"; in graphite upper margin: "horizontal joint / revised position of pebbles" / "new joint line for both top and bottom of screen"; in graphite upper right corner : "repeat revision"; a wavy red line inscribed across upper portion of sheet.
Third sheet [C]: in red pencil over graphite upper right: "THESE ARE NOT / CHANGED" [double underline and two arrows]; in graphite at right center margin: "vertical / joint / revised / position / of / pebbles"; in graphite lower margin: ["A" inscribed in a circle with arrow] match on / original drawing
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Design on main drawing consists of a random scattering of irregular oval shapes; ruled graphite lines and red colored pencil lines at upper and lower edged with arrows. Second sheet, attached at upper edge is a repeat revision of original design. The third sheet of tracing paper is attached to the others along the right edge.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Printed Textile-Pebbles, Series 1980-85", 1960.Brush and black ink, graphite and red colored pencil on three pieces of white tracing paper, fastened together with tape. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-352.
